subject: Re: [junit] Suggestion: New addition to the Assert class
msgSnippet: ... I have committed into CVS (JUnit-addons library) the methods: Assert.fail(Throwable cause) and Assert.fail(String message, Throwable cause) After a cvs
messageBody:
> Can i suggest that the following fail() method be added for the next
> release.
>
> static public void fail(Exception e) {
> throw new AssertionFailedError(e.toString());
> }

I have committed into CVS (JUnit-addons library) the methods:

Assert.fail(Throwable cause)
and
Assert.fail(String message, Throwable cause)

After a "cvs checkout", "ant release" and placing junit-addons-X.Y.jar
into your classpath, you can use them in your code:

public void testXYZ() {
try {
/* do something */
} catch (Exception e) {
junitx.Assert.fail(e);
}
}

I personally prefer to add "throws Exception" in the signature, but if
you prefer the "try/catch" method you have now the choice.

-Vladimir
